Reset Zoom level to 100% and scroll all the way down - more objects are loaded.The same in Chrome with less than 80% zoom

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Using Placeholders in Automation Rules - the Placeholders access data field values. Insight is rightly applying controls so that the accessing (Rule Executing) user needs to be an object scheme user to see the value. However, if you don’t have access not only is there no value but there is no warning in the logs when set to DEBUG.It’d be even better if the UI presented this warning. It knows who the placeholder will be executed as.Thanks, Martin
fields.summary: Warning message / Log entry when Executing User of an Automation Rule does not have sufficient Permissions

fields.description: Hi,i'm contacting you because people are complaining on the research function of the insight fields.As we are speaking in french and managing multiple datasources, the problématics are that : example : we have some datasources (where we are data consumers) which are writing with and some without accents. For example, we can find MEDECINE and Médecine. But when searching, if we don't use the accent, we won't find one or the other.it is, for us, a big problematic because people are complaining of this a lot.I don't know if this problematic is related to the DB or if Insight has some search parameters that could be modified.Thanks for your follow up.Regards,
fields.summary: Support Accented Letters comparison with non Accented Letters in IQL

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently the behaviour is this as per [Documentation|https://documentation.riada.io/insight/latest/insight-permissions-29299147.html]: "The object type permissions work the same way as the schema ones but on the object type level and have a higher priority in case of a clash." My request:Permission hierarchy should have AND condition between Schema and Object Type Roles.Advantage: Then developer permissions can be specified for Object type roles without influencing existing delvoper permissions for Schema roles. Thank you!PS see also [https://portal.riada.io/plugins/servlet/desk/portal/12/RPS-8860] in this context.
fields.summary: Permission hierarchy should have AND condition between Schema and Object Type Roles.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. Steps to reproduce: # Create 2 Object Types (one can be the copy of the other) with some Objects # Log in as a User who has both Manager and Developer Roles for the Object Types, but User Role for the Schema. Make sure that the User is not an Insight Admin # Move an Object from one object Type to the other - note that the Move option is available!h3. Expected behavior:The Object is moved from one Object type to the otherh3. Observed behavior:*Error*Sorry, you do not have permission to perform this action.. PermissionInsightException: User@nomail.com didn't have correct permission (manager).
fields.summary: Move Objects does not follow Object Type Role, only Schema Roles

fields.description: When referring to an object from another schema, in the attribute section indicate from which schema this comes from.In our case we have the object type "Servers" in multiple schemas.. for some objects it’s difficult to see from which schema the reference comes from. Yes when configuring the attribute you can see from which scheme it comes from but after it’s saved, you can’t edit it anymore and you can’t see from which schema it came from.
fields.summary: Indicate the Schema on a referencing Attribute

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Good day Riada,We would like to be able to customize the way Insight appears in the top navigation bar of Jira Service Desk. For JIRA/Insight users at our company, having "Insight" display in the navigation bar may cause some confusion (as our company currently produces an in-house application also coincidentally named "Insight").  Being able to 'rename' what displays on the button would allow for a much more focussed & clear deployment of the Insight product to one's respective user base.  For instance, customizing the button to say "Asset Objects" or "Asset Management" would really help the users.   I have attached a small screen capture of how the top navigation bar currently looks. Hopefully this is possible.   Thank you! Stanley WongSr. Technology Infrastructure AnalystIT Support Services - MPAC
fields.summary: Customize the way Insight displays in the top navigation bar

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I am using the 'Create an Insight Object from a Jira Issue' post function to create an object which is then displayed in the Insight custom field specified in 'Assign to Issue.' The problem is that the transition can be run multiple times and I want each additional object to be appended to that field. Instead, the field is overwritten with the newly created object. The field configuration has Multiple=Yes.Is this the expected behaviour? If so, could you please consider adding an 'append' option to the post function configuration screen? I've attached a mockup of what I mean.This issue is preventing me from integrating Insight in to a new workflow so I hope that you can address this or suggest a workaround. Thank you for your consideration!
fields.summary: Postfunction: Create Insight Object to allow ADDING the Newly created Object to existing one on an Insight Multiple Object CF

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We are using Insight. I am wondering if there is a Insight function (IQL function) to search in history.For example, we have phonenumbers which have a reference to a person. Sometimes the phonenumber will be removed from a user and not directly assigned to another. So we would like to have an IQL which can do something like this: "Show me all phonenumbers where the Person-Reference has been removed 3 month ago". Or, Show me all Phone Numbers which belonged to "Peter Pan"
fields.summary: IQL Filter to Swatch in History

fields.description: Hi I am working with a customer where they have a case. That they use an Object to specify alarm configurations, for monitoring their IT Environment. This means that when a new VM is requested they have a set of alarm descriptions that are specific for that VM, that are identical of other alarm descriptions the only change that is needed is the VM ip and hostname. This means they have to separately copy each object instead of making a IQL search and then make a bulk action on set objects.Is there any though of creating bulk copy functionality?
fields.summary: Functionality request "Bulk clone functionality"

fields.summary: Customfield Placeholder to support CF translations as well

fields.summary: Import Connection Type [Insight Object Scheme]

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I have an object whose Name is created from several CSV columns.I have a second object that needs to reference the first.Object 1 (Property) imports like this:Data Locator: Street, City, State (concat with ",")Attribute: Location (this is the Key field)Object 2Data Locator: Street, City, StateAttribute: Property (This is an Object dependent reference)This was resolved by the IQL: "Location startswith ${Street} AND Location LIKE ${City} AND Location endswith ${State}" It would be a big improvement though if IQL had some kind of concatenator operator like "+" such that I could writeLocation = ${Street} + " " + ${City} + " " + ${State}another approach would be a concatenator function such asconcat(delimiter, value1, value2, ...)Then I could writeLocation = concat(\s,${Street},${City},${State})
fields.summary: IQL Improvement -

fields.description: Be able to save a search filter
fields.summary: save filter

fields.description: The current icon for adding a new object in a Jira issue screen is hard for users to understand. It is unclear that the icon is a plus sign. Please change icon to something more obvious (or even spell out "add" in a link text.
fields.summary: Please change the "Create Object" Icon in the Issue View

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I've got the requirement to normalize phone numbers when imported from Active Directory into Insight to be available for queries in CTI-integration scenarios.Active directory stores phone numbers in the format "+43 (1) 71199-21234" or "+43 (664) 613 1234".Therefore I'd like to extract just the numbers and store them in separate attributes for exact matching, e.g.: "4317119921234" or "436646131234".I've tried that using the regular expression ".*?(\d+)" which almost works, but since the configuration field "concatenator" is mandatory I end up with "43-1-71199-21234" or "43-664-613-1234".I see multiple options to improve the possibilities here:1. Make concatenator an optional configuration which may be empty2. Don't just extract the first regex group but extract all groups in the regex and join them together (without concatenator).The second approach would be the most flexible solution as it would allow me to simply use the regex "+(\d+) ((\d+)) (\d+)-?(\d+)" and it would extract the values as expected.If there already exists an alternative way I'm not aware of, please let me know  !https://portal.riada.io/images/icons/emoticons/smile.png|width=16,height=16! .Regards,Andreas
fields.summary: Better import extraction functionality with Regular Expressions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Actually the "CF Insight - Read only" are filled when issue event as "Issue updated"/"Issue created" are fired.We also use another add-on and use our own event to send customized notification for example and we would like that the event also update the "CF Insight - Read only".So is it possible to customize which event update the "CF Insight - Read only"?
fields.summary: Ability to customize when update a "CF Insight - Read only"

fields.description: As a User, I would like to populate an Object's Attribute with a Value from a Referenced Object:for example: ${Product.Number} to get the value from the "Number" Attribute on the Object referenced in the "Product" Attribute on the Object which triggered the Automation rule
fields.summary: Automation Action: Attribute Value to support dot notation in placeholders

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Improvement Request

h3. Steps to reproduce: 
# have an Object Type with a reference Attribute - Type Value: Object and select a Reference Type as the Additional Value, e.g. "Belongs" 
# Navigate to Object Schema>Configure>References Tab # Change the "Belongs" Reference name to something else - e.g. "Related to" 
# go back to the Object type>Attributes Tab and see the Attribute's Additional Value

h3. Expected result:
The reference set in step 1 is now showing "Related to"

h3. Actual result:
The reference set in step 1 is still showing "Belongs"

h3. Workaround:
Re-index Insight, and refresh the browser after 2 min. had passed (cache was refreshed) and the Reference will show as "Related to" now.
fields.summary: updating Reference Names does not update Object Types right away

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We use Insight to manage customer data and link it to our service desk issues. It would be great to have TAPI ([Telephony Application Programming Interface|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephony_Application_Programming_Interface]) support, to phone the customer directly from the insight customer data object.
fields.summary: TAPI support

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. Improvement Requesth3. Steps to reproduce: # Create two Object Types: AAA,BBB # Have the Second Object Type referencing the first Object Type # Create one Object in AAA # Create more than 10 objects in BBB all referencing the object in AAA # go to the AAA Object and click to view Object Graphh3. Expected Result:The Object will show, and all Inbound references will show according to the "Inbound References" configuration, and enabled References.h3. Actual Result:If previously the "Inbound References" configured is less than the current number of inbound references - the correct indication will be shown in the Graph, but as I increase the number of "Inbound References" in the Graph Configuration - once I reach the number of the Actual inbound references - the Reference Type will be disabled - not leaving indication for any existing references.If previously the "Inbound References" configured is more than the current number of inbound references - No Inbound Referencing Objects will be visible, and no indication for the references will be showing on the Reference Type/Graph.h3. How to fix:Click the Graph Configuration button (cog wheel) and check the Reference Type
fields.summary: Object Graph not showing any inbound references

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I have an object reference attribute on my object. The referenced objects are appearing by name in ascending order.I could like to be able to reverse, or control the order, in some way.In my case my objects are 14,15,....,27,28,29. I would like to reverse the order 29,28,27,......,15,14I have tried to add the Order by to the "Filter by IQL" to the Attribute Configuration>IQL Filter but it has had no affect.
fields.summary: Objects Referenced in an Attribute - to follow Order By in the IQL filte

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be nice to have the Insight-Object (before update) in an eventfor Automation and Post-Function.This will enable the possibility to get/make a delta attribute check instead of fetching the Object-History
fields.summary: Object before update in events

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As object attribute we can have the type "Object" where we linke one object to another.In the case where the targeted objecType have multiple objects with the same name, it is impossible for now to separate one object from the other when are linking them. One have to test-select each object and see if it is the correct one.For custom-fields one have the option "Filter objects with attributes". This feature would be great to have on the object attributes. For example, one can then show the key/id for the objects in the list, making it possible again to see the differense between objects with same name.Steps to reproduce: * Create a objectType, e.g. "Tests" * Create a attribute of the type "Object" with value "Tests". Name it e..g "Object" * Create multiple objects with the same name, e.g. "Test" * On the third create, click the dropdown for setting the "Object" attribute.One can then see one have multiple objects named "Test" in the dropdown list, but no way to differentiate it. See the attached screenshot.!image-2019-06-04-21-54-42-570.png|width=328,height=258! Alternatively suggestion is to include the KEY of the object in the dropdown list, or any other way to identify which object is which.
fields.summary: "Filter objects with attributes" feature when creating/editing objects

fields.description: h2. Use-caseI would like to batch set by default an IQL to filter out objects within the object schema on objects references in an insight object attribute type

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: {color:#000000}Hi,{color}{color:#000000}I've used the Insight app for importing Jira/Bitbucket environment into Insight. I see the use for this to help us administrate Jira, and get followup reports e.g. if the Project Admins have not gone through training.{color}{color:#000000}You have delivered multiple of these apps to support import of different environments e.g. Azure and Snow.{color}{color:#000000}I was wondering - do you have a plan to create a app so we are able to import a Confluence environment?{color} {color:#000000}To be able to have this automatically imported into Insight (in the similar matter as for Jira) would be of great benefit for the company I work for. We can achieve this today by connecting to the database, but a import module would be much easier to configure and maintain.{color}{color:#000000}MVH / Best Regards Knut Arne Ristebråten {color}
fields.summary: Insight Integration - Confluence Environment Import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Our Japanese Windows users export Object as a CSV file and they like to open it in Excel immediately by double-clicking the CSV file. But, Excel in Japanese environment does not automatically detect UTF-8 and then garbled characters will occur...If we can select Encoding of CSV file with Shift_JIS(Windows-31J), we can solve this problem. It's more friendly to Japanese Windows users.
fields.summary: Encoding support Shift_JIS in Export

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: From Customer:While we can create 2 text Attributes, it will still complicates searching as you'd need to do something like {{MAC1 = "value" or MAC2 = "value"}}.Also, creating Objects to accomodate only the MAC address (like in Discovery - Network Interface), seems to be impractical for us, as we only need the MAC address.In that sense, it's not the same as having two text attributes. I was envisioning something like the labels field in Jira, where JQL can abstract away the fact that there's actually multiple text values stored in the database.
fields.summary: Allow Multiple Text Values in a Text Attribute (Cardinality >1)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the old report engine generate wrong format the XML's.When generate for example this XML: it's wrong because the tags could be repetited should have a root element for the tag like this: With the correct structure the xml could be imported to Excel for example and work with it.like I reported on case: h1. RPS-5802This bug has been solved if the deep of the tag is 1 works fine but when deep of the tag is more than 1, doesn't generate a root xml tag. You could see on the following screenshot:

fields.description: h3. Steps to reproduce: # configure two Insight CF so that you can use the Postfunction Change Insight Value into Insight Object (CF1 Source, CF2 Target) # Configure the Postfunction Change Insight Value into Insight Object in a Transition # Populate the two CFs and Transition the Issue # Note that the object/s in CF1 are now correctly populating the Referencing Attribute of the Object in CF2 # Now, delete all objects from CF1 and transition the Issue againh3. Expected Result:The Reference Attribute of the Object in CF2 has no value/objects in ith3. Actual Result:The Reference Attribute of the Object in CF2 is still showing the previous objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: if we choose UPDATE for Missing Object handling we have the choice to name a filed which can be updated with a specific information. Unfortunatelly there is not a such as a generic field valid for all object tpyes, but each object type got a selection of different set of fields.... This is not easy maintainable for 32 different object type... (as many of the fields allows only predefined values to be entered also).Is there a way to extend the schema of all 32 object types with one specific field used for this purpose? OR any other bast practice we are not aware of?We would like to store in such a field just a status information, that either:1. the object is missing as the sync failed for that subscription2. or the given resource or subscription was not available temporaly3. or even the resource was relinked to an other resource, but for history reasosns (e.g. service operations and audit) we need to maintain that information for a given remediation period.Thank you
fields.summary: Generic Attribute to update on all Object Types when an Object is Missing from the Import data

Expected result:The CF will show all selected Objects we have added in the Issue creationh3. Actual Result:The CF remains empty (no value) and no warning. if you click Update - then all existing Values will be removed from the CF.HAR File shows: !image-2019-09-12-12-16-43-141.png|width=843,height=306!

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The loading of the Insight import configuration tab in object schemas can get very slow if there are multiple imports defined (e.g. multiple AWS imports). It seems as if everything on the page is loaded directly when it is visited instead of, for instance, when one of the imports is expanded.Also, if there are a lot of object type mappings within one import definition, maybe these mappings could be loaded as the user scrolls down.In one environment, we have 5 AWS imports and one JSON. Not all object types are enabled. The page takes 1m+ to load while all other operations in Jira and Insight perform well.
fields.summary: Implement some sort of "paging" on the Insight import configuration page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if we could create a ticket directly from an Object instead of searching an object then go ticket creation then choosing the object previously found from the picker.A more practical example would be when using a the QR codes.  Scanning the QR codes allows to quickly go to the object page but then you would have to remember the name (or code) of the object when creating the ticket which is kind of awkward from a end user perspective.A normal user would not have to many items to browse from his profile, but from the tech perspective, it's a big waste of time when he has a lot of items to go through.
fields.summary: Create a ticket directly from Insight Object

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please include the ability to use AD credentials to databases for the import section of Insight.
fields.summary: DB Import - Improvement request

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a set of standard attributes that are used for all object types. We would like the ability to share the standard attributes across types, and when a definition for a standard attribute changes, that change can be done to the standard attribute and being seen by all types that share the attribute.The "add parent attributes" feature won't work for the change situation. After a parent attribute is added, any change to the parent attribute will not be carried out to the type that added the attribute before the change.
fields.summary: Share Standard Attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a long list of object types in the enterprise schema. We would like have grouped view of types such as by business lines or by other ways. A type should be able to be viewed in multiple groups.The parent-child type tree only allows a type be put under one parent, that does not support our case.
fields.summary: Grouped View of Object Types

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When I create a new reference, I review what are there already to avoid creating duplicate or confusingly similar ones. The Reference tab under the Schema configuration page only shows the references created by users, not the default references came with Insight. So I have to remember what the default ones before deciding on if create a new reference type. Suggest the Reference tab gives the full list of all references exist, even the default ones will not be editable by the user.
fields.summary: Show All References

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When I create a new icon, I review what are there already to avoid creating duplicate or confusingly similar ones. The Icons tab under the Schema configuration page only shows the icons created by users, not the default icons came with Insight. So I have to remember what the default ones before deciding on if create a new icon image. Suggest the Icons tab gives the full list of all icons exist, even the default ones will not be editable by the user.

fields.description: Would be nice to be able to use placeholders in Automation IF - conditions to limit automation execution e.g. Unit != ${PreviousUnit}
fields.summary: Use of Attribute Placeholders in Automation IF - conditions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: JIRA SD customer to go to the customer portal- scan the QR code printed from Insight.Then based on that scan information about this asset is automatically moved to JIRA SD ticket?Use case1. Customer enters SD portal with mobile phone2. Customer scans QR code from the bottom of his asset with his mobile phone3. Information of the scanned asset is automatically inserted to the JIRA SD ticket
fields.summary: Scan QR code in JSD Customer Portal --> add scanned info directly to JIRA issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hey,IQL only supports double quotes when an object or attribute contain whitespaces. This is a bit inconsistent with how many other languages do this.This becomes quite clear when using the JQL function _iqlFunction_.The function itself requires that the IQL is quoted (the outer quotes) and if the IQL contains objects/attributes containing whitespaces these need to be quoted as well (the inner quotes)This is a very common scenario.If I am only using double quotes I will need to escape all the inner quotes to make this work, e.g. _"My Domain(s)" in iqlFunction("\"Parent OU\" IN (\"Accountable CEO\")")_ This is really hard to read and trying to get users to understand this is almost impossible.I played around mixing double and single quotes here since this is a common way to get around this issue when you have outer and inner quotes present and found that the iqlFunction itself is happy with either single or double quotes and if I use this approach having single quotes as my outer quote the JQL will be a lot cleaner: _"My Domain(s)" in iqlFunction('"Parent OU" IN ("Accountable CEO")')_However, if I try the other way around having double quotes as my outer quotes and single quotes in my IQL query, Insight is throwing an error: *IQL in iqlFunction is not valid*The common practice in my opinion is that single and double quotes shall be possible to use independently meaning that they mean the same thing and shall be used when two sets of quotes are needed.I can refer to the similar JQL function, _issuefunction_ provided by the Script Runner which handles these two variants independently.Also in most programming languages it is ok to use either single or double quotes when e.g. a string is defined. It is the based on the user's preference which to use.So please consider supporting single quotes as well in IQL so that the user can choose how to manage situations when you need two sets of quotes.
fields.summary: Support single quotes in IQL

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Dear Riada,Please implement a freetext search in the objects' history. It would be very helpful.Thanks
fields.summary: Insight- history

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: # The Attributes edit tab of an object type needs to add an "align=top" to the table's html code so all the text are align to the top. Right now the table is aligned as the default to the middle, which makes it hard to read, especially when a description text is long. # The edit box should be a text area that allows multiple lines of text being visible to the person who does the editing. Right now all edit boxes are a one line box, so any longer text has to be done somewhere else of the person wants to see the content while editing, then post the text back to that line box. It is hard to do such back and forth without creating errors. # This one line edit box situation is in many edit forms, such as the Selector box of the Import type mapping form, for a SQL statement in any length to be visible only in that small one line box. Probably need an universal change of any form that contains textarea fields allows the edit box be a multiple line box.
fields.summary: Align the Attributes edit screen to the table top, and other input form tweaking

I have to expand every license to view it's the expiration date. It would really help to see that attribute without having to expand.See attached image for an explanation

I don't see this is doable now. I would assume this can be set by the configuration interface for the Status kind of attributes.

fields.description: h2. SymptomsIf you change the avatar for a Jira User but do not change any update any other attributes, the Importer does not update the avatar. When all attributes remain the same, the Importer recognise the Object as identical and does not update the Avatar.h2. Replication Steps # Create a Jira User Import # Import the Jira Users # Update an avatar of a Jira User # Synchronise the Importh2. Expected resultThe user import should import the users' new avatarh2. Actual resultThe avatar remains as the old one since the object is marked as identical.

fields.description: From our customers:We would like to be able to set the Logging level at Jira Startup, in order to reduce the logged information in the various Insight logs.Adding the following to log4j.properties has no effect:{code:java}log4j.logger.com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.schema.log.ImportLogger = ERROR, console, filelog log4j.additivity.com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.schema.log.ImportLogger = false{code}and log4j.logger.com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight = ERROR, console, filelog log4j.logger.log4j.additivity.com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight = falsedoes not affect the Import Package.

We've got a lot of questions from users on this topic, because they tend to click on "object", not on empty space.Thanks.

fields.description: Hello MindvillePlease create an object picker for attributes. This is an issue when an object attribute has more than 25 referenced objects.It is an unreasonable expectation to have end users go out of the object being edited, find the other object that should be referenced, copy the name, then go back to the object edit and paste it in the field to find the object. The feature while editing an Insight referenced object in Insight should mirror that of the Jira Insight Custom Fields. thanks,

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We would like to filter objects that are displayed in the object view.*+For example :+* # We've an object with many references. # Theses references are associated to attribute as "Status". # Some of them have a status "Inactive". # We don't want to get them in the view.*+In the print screen, you've an example where :+* # I've an attribute "Obsolete" with "false" as value. It could also be a status with "Inactive" or other. # All my "Inbound references", these references are not always "Active" or "Obsolete = True". # We only want "Inbound references" when the "Status" attribute = "Active" or "Obsolete" = "True".
fields.summary: Ability to filter "Inbound references" display in object view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We would like to know how to filter "Insight field values" based on other fields values even if it's empty.What do we have : - ObjectType "Location" and Insight Custom Field gets objects in "Location". - ObjectType "Company" and Insight Custom Field gets objects in "Company". - ObjectType "Person" and Insight Custom Field gets objects in "Person". - "Person" have 2 outbound references to "Company" and "Location" - "Location" have 1 inbound reference from "Person" and 1 outbound reference to "Company" - "Company" have 2 inbound references from "Person" and "Location" - IQL like this :-> "object HAVING inR(anyAttribute LIKE ${customfield_10610}) OR object HAVING outR(anyAttribute LIKE ${customfield_10618})"-> "object HAVING outR(anyAttribute LIKE (${customfield_10630},${customfield_10618}))"What do we expect : - If one of these fields is empty, all object contained in object type are showed. - If one of these fields has a value, other fields are filtered. - If 2 of these fields have a value, third field is filtered based on 2 other fields values.Example : - I've a form where I can choose a person or a company or a location. - I check these fields and I can see all value. - I select a company, results in Location and Person are filtered based on "Company" value. - I select a "Location", person are filtered based on their location and company.So if I'm looking for people who are in a location and company, via this method, I can see them. If I wanted to know what location or company are linked to a person, I select a person and get the result. If I didn't select a value, it musts show me all information available.
fields.summary: Ability to filter based on a field value

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As an Admin, whenever I configure an Insight CF, it will be really handy to test the IQL within an Issue context - to see the Values in the Placeholders:Much like the Script Console, provide an Issue context, and clicking a button you will see the IQL with Values replacing the Placeholders.

fields.description: At the moment, as described on [*Insight with JIRA REST-API*|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSSERV/Insight+with+JIRA+REST-API]:{quote}This is an example of setting an Insight object to a specific Insight custom field. Use the attribute set to define the Insight object keys{code:java}    {        "update" : {            "customfield_10200" : [{"set": [{"key" : "TEST-1"}]}]        }    }    {code}{quote}Our customers would like to be able to also use the Object's name as a way to update/set/delete from Insight custom fields.*Example:*{code:java}    {        "update" : {            "customfield_10200" : [{"set": [{"name" : "CPU"}]}]        }    }{code}OR{code:java}    {        "update" : {            "customfield_10200" : [{"set": [{"key" : "CPU"}]}]        }    }{code}
fields.summary: Modify the REST API to allow users to set an object to a custom field using the object name

fields.description: In Insight Automation, Action>Create a Jira Issue:In the Action Configuration screen, the editor/field for the Issue's Description allows 256 characters maximum - while in the Database, the Column hosting this information - DATA, is of the type Text, and may accommodate longer descriptions. The jiraissues Table has the description column of the Type Text as well, so it can have more than only 256 characters.It will be also nice to add a Rich Text editor here, or, make the Description support markup tags, so the Description can include bullets, numbering, headers, bold text etc.

UsercaseIf you execute a search in the new object page now and then immediately press enter again the new search results will render but there will be no indication that the results are the same unless you change something in the data set that returns (add/update/remove objects)h2. Requirements- Add a small date and timestamp to the results page so it would be clearer to the user when the search was last executed- Would be good to add the loading animation when you press enter again to indicate that the search is running.

fields.description: Currently - Date/Date and Time Attributes Format is following the Date/Date And Time Pickers, configured in Jira Administration>System>Advanced Settings.The Historical Values in the Object's History will show Old/New Date values as:`Sun, 17 May 2020 10:34:01 -0400`On the Schema Detailed view, the Old/New value will only show partially:`Sun, 17 May 2020...' and you can see the Time only by hovering over the value.It will be handy, if we can change the Format of the Historical Date/Date and Time Values - so we can simply see '17/05/20 10:34 AM' for example.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to change the Date Value Format showing in the History Old/New Value

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,We are using the Hebrew language, a Right-to-left (RTL) language, and having some problems with the way comments and textarea attributes are displayed.It looks like CKEditor is used for text formatting of comments and textarea attributes. Please add suuport using the 2 dedicated BiDi (Text Direction) buttons as described here: [https://ckeditor.com/docs/ckeditor4/latest/examples/language.html] With this addon: [https://ckeditor.com/cke4/addon/bidi]Thus will help us immensely.Best regards, Oren!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When CKEditor is used - allow Bidi buttons to allow Right to Left text

fields.description: Currently, we recommend to switch from using POST rest/insight/1.0/object/navlist/iql to GET /iql/objects - which will return ALL Attributes.It will be nice to be able to select the attributesToDisplay (i.e. the Attributes the user wishes to get) in the response, as available with rest/insight/1.0/object/navlist/iql
